meanings.definition: Made in imitation of something genuine with the intent to deceive or defraud.
meanings.sent1: The counterfeit watch looked real, but it was actually fake.
meanings.sent2: She bought a counterfeit purse that turned out to be a cheap copy.
meanings.sent3: The counterfeit money was so poorly made that even a child could tell it was fake.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a counterfeit coin, shiny but lacking true value.
meanings.sent5: The counterfeit diamond sparkled, but it was just a clever imitation.

meanings.definition: An imitation intended to be passed off as genuine.
meanings.sent1: The shopkeeper unknowingly sold a counterfeit painting to a collector.
meanings.sent2: The counterfeit of the famous painting fooled many art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: The counterfeit of the Mona Lisa made everyone laugh because it looked like a cartoon version.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a counterfeit of joy, hollow and insincere.
meanings.sent5: The counterfeit designer handbag was so well-made that it fooled even the experts.

meanings.sent1: He tried to counterfeit her signature on the document.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was arrested for attempting to counterfeit money.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to counterfeit their teacher's handwriting on the test.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to counterfeit her kindness was transparent and unconvincing.
meanings.sent5: The artist's goal was to counterfeit the style of the old masters in his paintings.
